CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Electrochemical measurements for small molecule 4b were carried out under nitrogen on a deoxygenated solution of tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate ( 0.1 M ) in distilled CH 2 Cl 2 using a computer - controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation , a glassy-carbon working electrode , a platinum - wire auxiliary electrode , and an Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate |
| CH2Cl2 |
| glassy-carbon |
| platinum |
| AgCl |
| Ag |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

I apologize for the mistake in my previous response. Here are the valid entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the given paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate |
| CH2Cl2 |
| glassy-carbon |

I removed "AgCl" and "Ag" from the list as they do not clearly refer to material names. "AgCl" is a chemical compound, but it is not a material name. "Ag" is a chemical element, and it is not a material name in this context.
